annotation.TEXT: I didn't know Tewi had a spell card involving launching Mimi-chan missiles at you!

Nuts! I ran out of moons and fell to my doom! Depending on how far you got, you'll see a different Touhou character on the Game Over screen. Hmm... Why did Yuyuko appear there? Failing at the clouds normally makes Aya appear, but I must've just been about to begin Yuyuko's section.
Okay, now just make it past the butterflies and I'll be fine...
So, it's kind of a balance issue. Do you stay on the right and try for fast points, or play it safer on the left?
There's your usual music/sound volume (bundled together again) and video quality options.
Alright, now the third selection contains some game options.
Now, the goal of this game is to advance as far as you can across various lands and accumulate points. If you fall off the bottom of the screen, the game is over.
D'oh, I missed! Oh, hello, Nue.
This is going well for me so far. Oftentimes I have to back off more than this on these parts of the second loop.
Okay, that bright thing in the background indicates that I'm making progress, but it might also make it slightly harder to see the UFOs, so pay attention.

Another thing to note: If you walk off of a platform and then jump, that jump won't use up a moon, so yeah, you can do a "Donkey Kong Country"-style jump for free, and it's really nice, because that means you don't have to worry about hitting the jump button slightly too late!
Nope, no yellow mushrooms. Well, I already demonstrated one in this recording, so I'm fine with that.

And that's it. Ooh, I improved on my old points high score! Also, if you complete at least one loop, this screen will show Reisen having captured Tewi, who I guess you've been chasing all this time for some reason.
Yes, I made it to the "breather level"! Okay, now in this part, you get a few seconds to rest and recover moons, and then you'll be climbing up falling keystones.

And then there's the name entry box, which also automatically appears the first time you play the game. Wait, my name's not "SomeGuy712xz"! Yeah, be careful of that. For some reason, the "Z" button input to select this option also adds a "z" to the end of your name, so be sure to "backspace" that out of there!

Oh, by the way, one interesting thing about this game in general is that the time of day (or at least, the time on the computer's clock) that you play this game affects the game's color scheme and background music. I recorded this at night, but if you play during the day, the background is brighter and the music is different.
I'm seeing Earth's atmosphere gradually coming into view... (Don't ask how Reisen can breathe and survive in space. It must be an innate ability of youkai in general.)
At first, you'll only see green UFOs, which start off stationary, but move either up or down while you're standing on them, so just be aware of that.
This might remind you of Hopping Tenshi (in fact, I bet the reference was intentional). However, this part is very easy!

Now, being on the far right does give Tewi an incredible boost in points over Reisen, but on the left, Tewi's unboosted rate is the same as Reisen's unboosted rate, so you've gotta hang out on the right as much as possible if you're playing for points!
Alright, now let's check out the other title screen options. The second one is the top 300 leaderboards, which I've gotten on. Let's see where I am now...
Oh, man, that sucked! I used up all my moons right there! But, I'm still alive. If I can just make it to the "Hopping Tenshi" section, I can completely recover.
Now, you can view other leaderboards by pressing left or right. This next one in ranked based on distance travelled rather than points.
Now, if you're playing for distance and not necessarily points, you'll probably want to back off a bit starting with the flowers, so that you don't get screwed over by the increased speed.
It's not so simple anymore, but still kind of easy... for now. Just make sure you "moon jump" if you miss a platform, and try not to miss too much.
Nuts. Well, there's Yuka.

On rare occasions, a yellow mushroom may appear, but I guess it didn't show up this time. If a yellow mushroom does appear and you bounce off it, you'll be sent high into the air for about 4 seconds. That might be a good time to move all the way to the right briefly for some quick points. Just be ready for when you come down!
The mushrooms are definitely trickier, although if you can hit the rare yellow mushroom, that can really help your score.
Also, I have never actually gotten hit here, so I have no idea what happens if you're hit, and it takes so much effort to get here that I don't exactly want to test that out!
However, the UFOs following this part are anything but easy...
Okay, now for the toughest and longest section of the game, UFO hopping! They're very small, and may move depending on their color.
Ooh, and Tewi gets to show off here by jumping up two keystones at a time with her higher jump!
Now, Tewi does have a higher basic jump than Reisen, but she cannot "moon jump" (she's not a moon rabbit like Reisen, after all). So, one mistake will end the game!
Also, failing on the mushrooms will make Marisa appear on the Game Over screen.
Note that you can't get boosted points during this part, so don't worry about that and just move wherever you need to.
In this game, you control Reisen, who's always running forward. You can move her left and right with the arrow keys, and you can press Z to jump.
Power MAX!! Alright, now for this fun part, you get unlimited moon jumps! I hope you're ready to start dodging stuff!

Ah, the "Hopping Tenshi" part. Obviously, failing here will make Tenshi appear on the Game Over screen, but that really shouldn't happen, unless maybe you fail at the very end of the butterflies (which has happened to me before).
Uh, oh! We're burning up! Don't let that distract you though! Just keep making those UFO jumps for a few more seconds!
Same deal with the butterflies. Of course, just one mistake ends it, so I still fail plenty often on these parts.
And, after all that, you return to the beginning of the game, but it's moving a bit faster now. Still, this first part remains crazy easy, so go ahead and rack up some quick points!
The ice ledges are only slightly trickier than the flowers, and note that they're not actually slippery, so you don't have to worry about ice physics in this game.

You can also jump again in midair by pressing Z again. However, doing so uses up one of your five moons, shown on the bottom of the screen. But, the spent moons will gradually be recovered while you're standing on the ground. You can midair jump as much as you want until you run out of moons.
And now for the UFOs, which I've never managed to get past with Tewi. Umm... Good luck!
Hello, and welcome to another Touhou flash game, Udon Gallop!
Whoops! Oh, hey there Cirno. How's it going?
Ooh, the rare yellow mushroom! Yes! I get to show that off in this recording!
Well, the menu options are in Japanese, but the title and menu controls are in English, which is nice. Now, let's choose the top option to get started here.
This looks very simple at first, the game's not going to remain this easy, of course! As you progress through the areas, the platforming will generally get trickier.

If you're just about all the way to the right, the numbers will turn red and you'll be gaining points 8x as fast as normal! Of course, being on the far right is risky, as you have practically no time to react to what's coming up.

I wonder if I'll see another yellow mushroom. There was one time when I saw two yellow mushrooms in one run, so it must be determined on a per-mushroom basis. Maybe it's a 1% chance per mushroom or something like that?
Yikes!

I think I recall having seen Reisen II at the Game Over screen as well by failing later on in the UFO section, and there might be others I haven't seen or forgot about. Well, I think that'll do for today. I hope you all enjoyed watching me play Udon Gallop! Bye!
However, note that you can't get boosted points during this part, so don't worry about hanging out on the right side of the screen.
Now, if you fail right at the start (which shouldn't happen at all if you're playing to do well), you'll see Eirin, and she's probably wondering why you didn't get very far.

Ah, now the platforming is getting a bit gimmicky. These mushrooms automatically bounce you into the air. However, each bounce recovers half of a used moon, so you can recover moons quickly here if you play well.
Now, by pressing right some more, you can see a third and fourth leaderboard. They pertain to the points scored and distance travelled in this game's Extra mode, which I'll get to in a moment.
And here's Yuyuko's section, which involves butterflies that fall after you land on them. Better jump off them quickly! Just like the clouds, I like to aim for every other butterfly if possible.
If you're trying for points but aren't comfortable in the "red zone", you can still get over 3x points in the "yellow zone", or more if you're at least hitting the "red zone" at times.
...and I'm in 39th for Extra mode's distance.

Oh, and assuming you're playing for points, you'll definitely want to hug the right side of the screen for the ridiculously easy first section. You should be able to get over 10,000 before the flowers show up.
On the second loop, the game will happily throw blue and red UFOs at you right off the bat! I've never made it past the UFO section a second time before. Maybe I will this time?
The flowers should also be easy enough to score major points on, though depending on your luck, you may have to spend a few moons if the flowers don't appear in good places for you.
And the fourth option there brings you back to the main menu. Now, the fourth option here appears to be the game's manual, in Japanese of course.

Now, on the Game Over screen, press Z to retry or Space to return to title. However, there's a lengthy black screen on the way back to the title, so I've cut nearly all of that out with WMM. (Incidentally, WMM changed the resolution of the footage from its initial 480x268 to 640x480, which is why this video may appear a bit stretched.)
Okay, let's see if I can make it past the clouds this time. I generally like to land on every other cloud if I can, though I usually can't maintain that pattern the whole way.
It's not looking good...
Maybe I should try playing it a bit safer on the flowers...
Certainly move all the way to the right for quick points while you're high in the sky, but be ready for when you come down!
The ability to jump after walking off a ledge is obviously much more important now!
You definitely should have well over 30,000 when the flowers first appear!
And now for the fifth option, this game's "Extra" mode, which is unlocked after you complete one loop of the normal game.
In this mode, you get to play the same game as Tewi!
I'm in 60th for Extra mode's points...
Ah, and now we're seeing blue UFOs. They're always moving up and down, and it can get really tricky if the game gives you several of them in a row.

Red UFOs generally start appearing around here. Just like the blue ones, they move up and down, but they can also turn invisible. It's just a visual thing, though, as you can still stand on them regardless of their appearance.
I am currently in 112th place here... (At least at the time I recorded this.)
Ah, there I am, in 61st place, which is an improvement over where I was when I started the recording.
Whew! Made it! Fortunately, the "Hopping Tenshi" section is still easy the second time around.
These clouds are pretty small and tough to land on. Hopefully, you won't screw up too much here, as spent moons are harder to recover at this point.
Now, if you'll take a look at my score in the lower-right, you might notice something. It changes color when I get near the right side of the screen, and it also increases faster.
Of course, the incredible boost to points makes sense, as it's far riskier to hang out on the right side without moons...

However, she can earn points way faster than Reisen! If you're in the yellow, you're already earning over 8x points, which is slightly faster than Reisen's "red zone". And if you're in the red, your points increase at a rate of 27x!!!
This part is definitely very tough to try scoring well on, so I usually don't bother trying to stay on the right here. Try not to miss too much, as recovering moons is very difficult now.
Okay, there's the back end of that bright sun, so there's not too much farther to go...
Now, while this part can be tricky, I actually find it easier to maintain the "every other cloud" pattern with Tewi. It must be due to her higher basic jump.
